content: Write a sonnet where each line begins with a different letter of the alphabet, starting with A and ending with N.

Amidst the verdant fields where nature reigns,
Beneath the azure sky so vast and bright,
Cascading rivers sing their endless refrains,
Dancing with the wind in morning light.

Every leaf, a poem etched by time,
Flowers bloom in colors wild and free,
Gently swaying to the rhythm's chime,
Heralding the dawn's new symphony.

In shadows deep, where secrets lie concealed,
Jewels of dew glisten on petals fair,
Kindred spirits in the breeze revealed,
Lofty mountains watch with patient care.

Majestic trees stand tall through storm and shine,
Nature's embrace, where peace begins divine.
